results.title: SOS
results.brief_description: Comical but scathing indictment of man’s age-old exploitation of women, presented via the historical theories of a mad professor who is convinced that women are temporary visitors from a far-away galaxy. Starring Maurizio Nichetti as the teacher. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Tale of a TV mouse
results.brief_description: The story of a puppet mouse named Lucille, whose entire life revolves around the television. Shows how it affects her life and what finally happens to convince her to break the TV habit. Presents the problems of habitual TV viewing and provides positive alternatives for children who watch a lot of TV.

results.title: Beyond cubism
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at some of the sculpture of this century, including the works, philosophies and sources of inspiration of such artists as Marcel Duchamp, Man Ray, Joan Miro, Alexander Calder, Alberto Glacommetti, Barbara Hepworth and Anthony Caro.

results.title: Angles
results.creator_credit: Jean Nunn, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: This film shows how to calculate angles, heights and distances using formulae, and provides practical applications such as the felling of a tree and the radius and distance walked by a horse during training. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Circus: Serrina becomes an acrobat
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows Serrina, aged ten, training to become an acrobat in the circus. Highlights the demands and frustrations in becoming a circus performer. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Smoking: the choice is yours
results.creator_credit: John Ewing and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: A Disney animated production dealing with some of the issues of smoking. The central character decides to try smoking in an effort to gain respect from others. A courtroom scene occurs where the pros and cons of smoking are debated and eventually the hero decides not to smoke. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Jacob: 'Everybody's allowed to cry'
results.creator_credit: Lyn Bugden, Australian Film Commission and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A moving documentation of the life of a small boy about to face his sixth major operation in six years. Raises questions of care for the hospitalised, the rights of the patient and family, and the emotional requirements of people reliant on technology for life support. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Peru: the revolution that never was
results.creator_credit: Peter Tiffin, David Elstein and Thames Television
results.brief_description: Shows the abject poverty and miserable life style still endured by Peruvian peasant farmers, and notes how the changes to the land tenure system brought about by the 1968 revolution have failed to bring any change in the deplorable living standards of the Peruvian peasant farmer. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: Bolivia: the tin mountain
results.creator_credit: Martin Smith, David Elstein and Thames Television
results.brief_description: A moving presentation showing the desperate poverty in the lives of the tin miners of Bolivia. Notes the problems of lack of capital, absentee ownership of the tin mines, market forces and the political system which influence the prices of tin and hence the life style of the miners. Narrated by Jonathan Dimbleby. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
